timeline.message: Don't propagate gossip messages with 'from', 'signature' or 'seqno' fields set

timeline.bodyText: Any particular reason to make this a singleton?  Its not very common in the teku codebase.
timeline.author: mbaxter

replies.bodyText:
I remember you had the similar concern regarding very similar case (found it: #2376 (comment)). I'm not sure I understand your concerns regarding this pattern. Can you please explain in more details? From my perspective singleton is suitable in this case cause it has no state and just a single class instance makes sense here.
Do you think this variant is better: 141ddf1 ?
replies.author: Nashatyrev

replies.bodyText:
No real strong reason to oppose singletons - mostly just trying to keep a consistent style.  I suppose when I see a singleton I think there must be some concrete reason why we only ever want a single instance.  I think we generally would create a new instance and pass it in:  router.setValidator(new GossipWireValidator());
Sorry, forgot I raised this before - just trying to come to a consensus on code style, but I don't think this actually matters that much so happy to leave the decision with you.
replies.author: mbaxter

replies.bodyText: Thanks for explanations 👍 I'm totally fine with either style and agree that it's always better sticking to one style. Just really wanted to understand the rationale
replies.author: Nashatyrev

replies.bodyText: In general, singletons tend to be a bit controversial because they create global state and can make testing complicated in terms of being able to inject unique instances / mock things easily.
replies.author: mbaxter
